message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item that will meet your needs. I'm willing to offer it to you for $15000.
Hello Alice, thank you for considering my interest in your product. I appreciate the value it holds, but I believe I can offer a more reasonable price of $12000.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product, but I'm afraid I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make $14000 to make it worth my while. How about we discuss a price of $14000?
Thank you for your response, Alice. Considering the value of the product and my budget, I would like to propose a price of $13000.
I appreciate your persistence, Bob. However, I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make $13500 to justify the sale. How about we meet in the middle at $13500?
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I understand your position, but I am still unable to meet your asking price. I would like to propose a final offer of $13000.
I'm starting to think we're getting nowhere, Bob. I'm willing to make one last concession. I'll meet you at $13250, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. This is my final offer.
I appreciate your efforts to reach an agreement, Alice. Based on our previous discussions, I would like to propose a final offer of $13000.

I've already made concessions, Bob. I'm not willing to go any lower than $13500. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to explore other options. I'm willing to sell to someone else who values the product more. My final offer is $13500.
